member.name: T:Voltaic.Mcp.McpClient
member.summary: MCP client using stdio transport for subprocess-based MCP servers. Implements Model Context Protocol stdio transport specification.

member.name: E:Voltaic.Mcp.McpClient.Log
member.summary: Occurs when a log message is generated.

member.name: E:Voltaic.Mcp.McpClient.NotificationReceived
member.summary: Occurs when a notification (request without an ID) is received from the server.

member.name: P:Voltaic.Mcp.McpClient.IsConnected
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the client is currently connected to a server.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpClient.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpClient.LaunchServerAsync(System.String,System.String[],System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Launches an MCP server as a subprocess and connects to it via stdio.
member.param: The path to the MCP server executable.
The command-line arguments to pass to the server.
Cancellation token for the operation.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result is true if the launch was successful; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpClient.CallAsync``1(System.String,System.Object,System.Int32,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously invokes a remote method and returns the result as the specified type.
member.typeparam: The type to deserialize the result into.
member.param: The name of the method to invoke.
The parameters to pass to the method. Can be null.
The timeout in milliseconds to wait for a response. Default is 30000 (30 seconds).
Cancellation token for the operation.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains the method result.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpClient.NotifyAsync(System.String,System.Object,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously sends a notification to the server. Notifications are fire-and-forget and do not expect a response.
member.param: The name of the notification method.
The parameters to pass with the notification. Can be null.
Cancellation token for the operation.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpClient.Shutdown
member.summary: Shuts down the MCP server gracefully by closing stdin.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpClient.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the .

member.name: T:Voltaic.Mcp.McpHttpClient
member.summary: Provides an HTTP-based MCP (Model Context Protocol) client implementation. Supports JSON-RPC 2.0 over HTTP with Server-Sent Events (SSE) for server-to-client notifications.

member.name: P:Voltaic.Mcp.McpHttpClient.SessionId
member.summary: Gets the session ID assigned by the server. This ID is used to correlate requests and receive notifications via SSE.

member.name: P:Voltaic.Mcp.McpHttpClient.IsConnected
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the client is currently connected to a server. A client is considered connected if it has a valid session ID.

member.name: P:Voltaic.Mcp.McpHttpClient.IsSseConnected
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the SSE (Server-Sent Events) connection is active.

member.name: P:Voltaic.Mcp.McpHttpClient.RequestTimeoutMs
member.summary: Gets or sets the request timeout in milliseconds. Default is 30000 (30 seconds). Minimum is 1000 (1 second).

member.name: E:Voltaic.Mcp.McpHttpClient.Log
member.summary: Occurs when a log message is generated.

member.name: E:Voltaic.Mcp.McpHttpClient.NotificationReceived
member.summary: Occurs when a notification (request without an ID) is received from the server via SSE.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpHttpClient.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpHttpClient.ConnectAsync(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously connects to an HTTP MCP server at the specified base URL. This method will make an initial request to establish a session.
member.param: The base URL of the server (e.g., "http://localhost:8080").
The RPC endpoint path. Default is "/rpc".
The SSE events endpoint path. Default is "/events".
Cancellation token for the operation.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result is true if the connection was successful; otherwise, false.
member.exception: Thrown when baseUrl is null or empty.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpHttpClient.StartSseAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously starts the Server-Sent Events (SSE) connection to receive notifications from the server. A session must be established before calling this method.
member.param: Cancellation token for the operation.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result is true if the SSE connection was established; otherwise, false.
member.exception: Thrown when no session has been established.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpHttpClient.StopSse
member.summary: Stops the Server-Sent Events (SSE) connection.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpHttpClient.CallAsync``1(System.String,System.Object,System.Int32,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously invokes a remote method and returns the result as the specified type.
member.typeparam: The type to deserialize the result into.
member.param: The name of the method to invoke.
The parameters to pass to the method. Can be null.
The timeout in milliseconds to wait for a response. Default is the value of RequestTimeoutMs property.
Cancellation token for the operation.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains the method result.
member.exception: Thrown when the client has not been initialized.
Thrown when the remote method returns an error.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpHttpClient.Disconnect
member.summary: Disconnects from the server and stops the SSE connection if active.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpHttpClient.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the .

member.name: T:Voltaic.Mcp.McpHttpServer
member.summary: Provides an HTTP-based MCP (Model Context Protocol) server implementation. Supports JSON-RPC 2.0 over HTTP POST with Server-Sent Events (SSE) for server-to-client notifications.

member.name: P:Voltaic.Mcp.McpHttpServer.SessionTimeoutSeconds
member.summary: Gets or sets the session timeout in seconds. Sessions that have been inactive for longer than this will be expired. Default is 300 seconds (5 minutes). Minimum is 10 seconds.

member.name: P:Voltaic.Mcp.McpHttpServer.EnableCors
member.summary: Gets or sets whether CORS (Cross-Origin Resource Sharing) is enabled. When enabled, the server will accept requests from any origin. Default is true to support browser-based clients.

member.name: P:Voltaic.Mcp.McpHttpServer.TokenSource
member.summary: Gets the cancellation token source for the server.

member.name: E:Voltaic.Mcp.McpHttpServer.Log
member.summary: Occurs when a log message is generated.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpHttpServer.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The port number to listen on. Must be between 0 and 65535.
The URL path for JSON-RPC requests. Default is "/rpc".
The URL path for Server-Sent Events connections. Default is "/events".
True to include default MCP methods such as echo, ping, getTime, and getSessions.
member.exception: Thrown when the port is invalid.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpHttpServer.RegisterMethod(System.String,System.Func{System.Nullable{System.Text.Json.JsonElement},System.Object})
member.summary: Registers a custom RPC method with the specified handler.
member.param: The name of the method to register.
The function that handles the method invocation. Receives optional JSON parameters and returns a result object.
member.exception: Thrown when name or handler is null.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpHttpServer.StartAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Starts the HTTP server and begins listening for requests asynchronously. This method will continue running until Stop() is called or the cancellation token is triggered.
member.param: Cancellation token for the operation.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.
member.exception: Thrown when the server is already running.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpHttpServer.SendNotificationToSession(System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Broadcasts a notification to a specific session. The notification will be queued and delivered via the SSE connection if active.
member.param: The session ID to send the notification to.
The name of the notification method.
The parameters to pass with the notification. Can be null.
member.returns: True if the notification was queued; false if the session does not exist.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpHttpServer.BroadcastNotification(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Broadcasts a notification to all active sessions. Notifications are queued and delivered via SSE connections.
member.param: The name of the notification method.
The parameters to pass with the notification. Can be null.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpHttpServer.GetActiveSessions
member.summary: Gets a list of all active session IDs.
member.returns: A list of session IDs.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpHttpServer.RemoveSession(System.String)
member.summary: Removes a session and its notification queue.
member.param: The session ID to remove.
member.returns: True if the session was found and removed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpHttpServer.Stop
member.summary: Stops the server and closes all active sessions.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpHttpServer.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the .

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpHttpServer.RegisterBuiltInMethods
member.summary: Registers the built-in MCP methods: ping, echo, getTime, and getSessions. This method is virtual to allow derived classes to customize the set of built-in methods.

member.name: T:Voltaic.Mcp.McpServer
member.summary: MCP server using stdio transport for subprocess-based operation. Implements Model Context Protocol stdio transport specification.

member.name: E:Voltaic.Mcp.McpServer.Log
member.summary: Occurs when a log message is generated.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpServer.#ctor(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: True to include default methods such as echo, ping, and getTime.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpServer.RegisterMethod(System.String,System.Func{System.Nullable{System.Text.Json.JsonElement},System.Object})
member.summary: Registers a custom RPC method with the specified handler.
member.param: The name of the method to register.
The function that handles the method invocation.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpServer.RunAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Runs the MCP server, reading from stdin and writing to stdout. Blocks until stdin is closed or cancellation is requested.
member.param: Cancellation token to stop the server.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpServer.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the .

member.name: T:Voltaic.Mcp.McpTcpClient
member.summary: Provides a TCP-based MCP (Model Context Protocol) client implementation for making remote procedure calls over a network. This class extends JsonRpcClient with MCP-specific semantics and branding.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpTcpClient.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: T:Voltaic.Mcp.McpTcpServer
member.summary: Provides a TCP-based MCP (Model Context Protocol) server implementation for handling remote procedure calls over a network. This class extends JsonRpcServer with MCP-specific defaults and semantics.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpTcpServer.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The port number to listen on.
True to include default MCP methods such as echo, ping, getTime, and getClients.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpTcpServer.RegisterBuiltInMethods
member.summary: Registers the built-in MCP methods: ping, echo, getTime, and getClients. Note: Unlike JsonRpcServer, this does not include the 'add' method.

member.name: T:Voltaic.Mcp.McpWebsocketsClient
member.summary: Provides a WebSocket-based MCP (Model Context Protocol) client implementation. Supports bidirectional communication with MCP servers over WebSocket connections.

member.name: P:Voltaic.Mcp.McpWebsocketsClient.MaxMessageSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum message size in bytes that can be received. Default is 1 MB (1048576 bytes). Minimum is 4096 bytes.

member.name: P:Voltaic.Mcp.McpWebsocketsClient.IsConnected
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the client is currently connected to a server.

member.name: E:Voltaic.Mcp.McpWebsocketsClient.Log
member.summary: Occurs when a log message is generated.

member.name: E:Voltaic.Mcp.McpWebsocketsClient.NotificationReceived
member.summary: Occurs when a notification (request without an ID) is received from the server.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpWebsocketsClient.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpWebsocketsClient.ConnectAsync(System.String,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously connects to a WebSocket MCP server at the specified URL.
member.param: The WebSocket URL to connect to (e.g., "ws://localhost:8080/mcp" or "wss://example.com/mcp").
Cancellation token for the operation.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result is true if the connection was successful; otherwise, false.
member.exception: Thrown when url is null or empty.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpWebsocketsClient.CallAsync``1(System.String,System.Object,System.Int32,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously invokes a remote method and returns the result as the specified type.
member.typeparam: The type to deserialize the result into.
member.param: The name of the method to invoke.
The parameters to pass to the method. Can be null.
The timeout in milliseconds to wait for a response. Default is 30000 (30 seconds).
Cancellation token for the operation.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains the method result.
member.exception: Thrown when the client is not connected.
Thrown when the remote method returns an error.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpWebsocketsClient.NotifyAsync(System.String,System.Object,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously sends a notification to the server. Notifications are fire-and-forget and do not expect a response.
member.param: The name of the notification method.
The parameters to pass with the notification. Can be null.
Cancellation token for the operation.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.
member.exception: Thrown when the client is not connected.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpWebsocketsClient.Disconnect
member.summary: Disconnects from the server and cancels all pending requests.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpWebsocketsClient.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the .

member.name: T:Voltaic.Mcp.McpWebsocketsServer
member.summary: Provides a WebSocket-based MCP (Model Context Protocol) server implementation. Supports bidirectional communication over WebSocket connections with full JSON-RPC 2.0 support.

member.name: P:Voltaic.Mcp.McpWebsocketsServer.MaxMessageSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum message size in bytes that can be received. Default is 1 MB (1048576 bytes). Minimum is 4096 bytes.

member.name: P:Voltaic.Mcp.McpWebsocketsServer.KeepAliveIntervalSeconds
member.summary: Gets or sets the WebSocket keep-alive interval in seconds. Default is 30 seconds. Set to 0 to disable keep-alive.

member.name: P:Voltaic.Mcp.McpWebsocketsServer.TokenSource
member.summary: Gets the cancellation token source for the server.

member.name: E:Voltaic.Mcp.McpWebsocketsServer.Log
member.summary: Occurs when a log message is generated.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpWebsocketsServer.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The port number to listen on. Must be between 0 and 65535.
The URL path for WebSocket connections. Default is "/mcp".
True to include default MCP methods such as echo, ping, getTime, and getClients.
member.exception: Thrown when the port is invalid.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpWebsocketsServer.RegisterMethod(System.String,System.Func{System.Nullable{System.Text.Json.JsonElement},System.Object})
member.summary: Registers a custom RPC method with the specified handler.
member.param: The name of the method to register.
The function that handles the method invocation. Receives optional JSON parameters and returns a result object.
member.exception: Thrown when name or handler is null.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpWebsocketsServer.StartAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Starts the WebSocket server and begins listening for client connections asynchronously. This method will continue running until Stop() is called or the cancellation token is triggered.
member.param: Cancellation token for the operation.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.
member.exception: Thrown when the server is already running.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpWebsocketsServer.BroadcastNotificationAsync(System.String,System.Object,System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously broadcasts a notification to all connected clients. Notifications are fire-and-forget JSON-RPC requests without an ID.
member.param: The name of the notification method.
The parameters to pass with the notification. Can be null.
Cancellation token for the operation.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpWebsocketsServer.KickClient(System.String)
member.summary: Kicks a client by disconnecting them from the server.
member.param: The ID of the client to kick.
member.returns: True if the client was found and kicked; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpWebsocketsServer.GetConnectedClients
member.summary: Gets a list of all currently connected client IDs.
member.returns: A list of client IDs.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpWebsocketsServer.Stop
member.summary: Stops the server and disconnects all clients gracefully.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpWebsocketsServer.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the .

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.McpWebsocketsServer.RegisterBuiltInMethods
member.summary: Registers the built-in MCP methods: ping, echo, getTime, and getClients. This method is virtual to allow derived classes to customize the set of built-in methods.

member.name: T:Voltaic.Mcp.NotificationQueue
member.summary: Represents a notification queue for a specific client session. Used by the HTTP server to queue notifications that will be delivered via Server-Sent Events.

member.name: P:Voltaic.Mcp.NotificationQueue.SessionId
member.summary: Gets the session ID associated with this queue.

member.name: P:Voltaic.Mcp.NotificationQueue.LastActivity
member.summary: Gets the timestamp of the last activity on this queue. Updated when notifications are enqueued or dequeued.

member.name: P:Voltaic.Mcp.NotificationQueue.MaxQueueSize
member.summary: Gets the maximum number of notifications that can be queued. When the limit is reached, oldest notifications are discarded. Default is 100 notifications.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.NotificationQueue.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The session ID for this queue.
member.exception: Thrown when sessionId is null or empty.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.NotificationQueue.Enqueue(Voltaic.JsonRpc.JsonRpcRequest)
member.summary: Enqueues a notification into the queue. If the queue is at maximum capacity, the oldest notification will be discarded.
member.param: The notification to enqueue.
member.exception: Thrown when the queue has been disposed.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.NotificationQueue.DequeueAsync(System.Threading.CancellationToken)
member.summary: Asynchronously waits for and dequeues a notification from the queue. This method will block until a notification is available or the cancellation token is triggered.
member.param: Cancellation token for the operation.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous operation. The task result contains the dequeued notification, or null if the operation was cancelled.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.NotificationQueue.DequeueAll
member.summary: Gets all notifications currently in the queue and clears it.
member.returns: A list of all notifications that were in the queue.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.NotificationQueue.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of notifications currently in the queue.
member.returns: The number of notifications in the queue.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.NotificationQueue.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the .

member.name: T:Voltaic.Mcp.WebSocketConnection
member.summary: Represents a WebSocket client connection on the server side. Encapsulates the WebSocket instance and client metadata.

member.name: P:Voltaic.Mcp.WebSocketConnection.Id
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier for this client connection.

member.name: P:Voltaic.Mcp.WebSocketConnection.WebSocket
member.summary: Gets the underlying WebSocket instance.

member.name: P:Voltaic.Mcp.WebSocketConnection.CancellationTokenSource
member.summary: Gets the cancellation token source for this connection.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.WebSocketConnection.#ctor(System.String,System.Net.WebSockets.WebSocket)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The unique identifier for this connection.
The WebSocket instance.

member.name: M:Voltaic.Mcp.WebSocketConnection.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the .
